Ideally, the aerosol‐generating procedures are planned for the last appointment of the day. As per WHO (2020) and OSHA recommendations, the patients should be transferred to a safer room with negative pressure ventilation and with 12 air changes/hour "ACH" or 160 L/s/patient.
60 The same protocol is recommended for emergency treatment of geriatric patients who test positive for COVID‐19. It is strongly recommended that an anti‐retraction dental handpiece is used with specially designed anti‐retractive valves or other anti‐reflux designs as a preventive measure for cross‐infection.
61 ,
62 When indicated, dentists must place rubber dams to minimise splatter generation and aspiration of viral particles from the oral cavity to nasopharynx. It is also necessary to use high volume evacuators (HVE) while performing any dental procedure.
